results.title: Adult development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Rachel Rosenthal and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
For all of us, adult life is full of transitions and turning points. How do adults develop psychologically? Do their changes follow some set course, or is their growth varied and unpredictable? This program examines the major transitions in adult life - leaving home, parenting, mid-life crisis and retirement, by interviewing both psychologists and adults going through each of these stages.

results.title: Adriana Lecouvreur
results.creator_credit: Hugh Davidson, John Copley, ABC-TV (Australia) and Opera Australia
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House on 18 February 1984 this performance of Francesco Cilea’s ” Adriana Lecouvreur” features the grand voice of Dame Joan Sutherland, along with John Shaw, Anson Austin and Heather Begg, The Australian Opera Chorus and The Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra conducted by Richard Bonynge. Set in four acts, it tells the tragic story of a Parisian actress, Adriana Lecouvreur. “This is an excellently sung, played and staged production of this lovely, lyrical opera”…(The Canberra Times). Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Adrian
results.creator_credit: Allan Kidston and Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disability Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
Adrian shows how children with developmental delay can be successfully integrated in kindergarten with cooperation between parents, kindergarten staff and the Early Intervention Program.

results.title: Adorable Menteuse = Such an Adorable Liar
results.brief_description:
Juliette and Sophie share an apartment. Juliette is a garrulous 18-year-old girl who can’t go five minutes without telling a lie. She spies on her upstairs neighbour, a man of 40, pretending she is in love with him … until the day she really is. She vows to reform and speak nothing but the truth. But her reputation precedes her and her gentleman friend refuses to take anything she says seriously.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Michel Deville ; writers, Nina Companeez, Michel Deville ; photography, Claude Lecomte ; music, Jean Dalve.
Cast: Marina Vlady, Macha Meril, Ginette Letondal, Jean-Marc Bory, Michel Vitold, Jean-Francois Calve, Claude Nicot, Michel Lonsdale, Christian Alers.

results.title: Adoption: children are waiting
results.creator_credit: Laurie Jennings, Lee Gordon, National Film Board of Canada and Westminster Films
results.brief_description: This film will inform and encourage prospective adopting parents and be helpful to professionals in the child-welfare field. In interviews, three couples relate their experiences of adopting older or handicapped children. A fourth couple explains how they, as foster parents, try to prepare children emotionally for adoption.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurie Jennings, Lee Gordon, National Film Board of Canada and Westminster Films

results.title: Adolescent development = Adolescence
results.creator_credit: Leslie Hill and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Adolescence is the period which occurs anywhere between 10 and 20 years of age, and during which we are trying to work out who we are. At this time we mature physically, sexually, socially, intellectually and morally, but not necessarily at the same rate, which is where some of the conflicts and embarrassments of adolescence occur. The peer group becomes of prime importance as it provides feedback on appropriate behaviour. This program takes a generally positive view of this period as an exciting challenge.

results.title: Adolescence: the prolonged transition
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Through historical and cross-cultural comparisons, the extent to which the concept of adolescence as a period of increased autonomy, identity development, and risk-taking, is a social construction, is examined. The biological aspects of puberty and emerging sexuality are addressed. Observes examples of adolescents in transition from family to a broader adult world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
